title: Awesome List Updates on Apr 13, 2025
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Apr 13, 2025 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome European Tech
items.content_text:
### Index / Identity and Access Management (IAM)

*   [Ory](https://www.ory.sh/) üá©üá™ - Company developing (C)IAM, OpenID Connect provider, and fine-grained permissions open source solutions.
*   [Zitadel](https://zitadel.com/) üá®üá≠ - Open-source identity and access management infrastructure.
items.content_html:
Index / Identity and Access Management (IAM)

  • Ory üá©üá™ - Company developing (C)IAM, OpenID Connect provider, and fine-grained permissions open source solutions.
  • Zitadel üá®üá≠ - Open-source identity and access management infrastructure.

items.title: Awesome Zsh Plugins
items.content_text:
### Plugins / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [release-fetcher (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/Game4Move78/zsh-release-fetcher) - Fetches latest release and checks if you trust the identity used to sign the tag.
items.content_html:
Plugins / superconsole - Windows-only

  • release-fetcher (‚≠ê0) - Fetches latest release and checks if you trust the identity used to sign the tag.

items.title: Awesome Selfhosted
items.content_text:
### Software / Analytics

*   [Aptabase](https://aptabase.com/) - Privacy first and simple analytics for mobile and desktop apps. ([Source Code (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/aptabase/aptabase)) `AGPL-3.0` `Docker`

### Software / Archiving and Digital Preservation (DP)

*   [bitmagnet](https://bitmagnet.io) - BitTorrent indexer, DHT crawler, content classifier and torrent search engine with web UI, GraphQL API and Servarr stack integration. ([Source Code (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/bitmagnet-io/bitmagnet)) `MIT` `Go/Docker`

### Software / Automation

*   [Apache Airflow](https://airflow.apache.org/) - Platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows. ([Source Code (‚≠ê41k)](https://github.com/apache/airflow/)) `Apache-2.0` `Python/Docker`

### Software / Booking and Scheduling

*   [Alf.io](https://alf.io/) - Ticket reservation system. ([Demo](https://demo.alf.io/authentication), [Source Code (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/alfio-event/alf.io)) `GPL-3.0` `Java`

### Software / Bookmarks and Link Sharing

*   [Buku (‚≠ê6.8k)](https://github.com/jarun/Buku) - Powerful bookmark manager and a personal textual mini-web. `GPL-3.0` `Python/deb`

### Software / Communication - Email - Complete Solutions

*   [AnonAddy](https://anonaddy.com) - Email forwarding service for creating aliases. ([Source Code (‚≠ê3.9k)](https://github.com/anonaddy/anonaddy)) `MIT` `PHP/Docker`

### Software / Communication - Social Networks and Forums

*   [Answer](https://answer.dev/) - Knowledge-based community software. You can use it to quickly build your Q\&A community for product technical support, customer support, user communication, and more. ([Source Code (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/answerdev/answer)) `Apache-2.0` `Docker/Go`
*   [Artalk](https://artalk.js.org/) - Comment system built in Golang, providing a lightweight and highly customizable solution for adding comments to your website. ([Source Code (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/ArtalkJS/Artalk)) `MIT` `Go/Docker`
*   [AsmBB](https://board.asm32.info) - Fast, SQLite-powered forum engine written in ASM. ([Source Code](https://asm32.info/fossil/asmbb/index)) `EUPL-1.2` `Assembly`

### Software / Content Management Systems (CMS)

*   [BigTree CMS](https://www.bigtreecms.org/) - Straightforward, well documented, and capable CMS. ([Source Code (‚≠ê220)](https://github.com/bigtreecms/BigTree-CMS)) `LGPL-2.1` `PHP`
*   [Bludit](https://www.bludit.com/) `‚ö†` - Build a site or blog in seconds. Bludit uses flat-files (text files in JSON format) to store posts and pages. ([Source Code (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/bludit/bludit)) `MIT` `PHP`

### Software / DNS

*   [AdGuard Home](https://adguard.com/en/adguard-home/overview.html) - User-friendly ads & trackers blocking DNS server. ([Source Code (‚≠ê29k)](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardHome)) `GPL-3.0` `Docker`
*   [blocky](https://0xerr0r.github.io/blocky/latest/) - Fast and lightweight DNS proxy as ad-blocker for local network with many features (alternative to Pi-hole). ([Source Code (‚≠ê5.4k)](https://github.com/0xERR0R/blocky)) `Apache-2.0` `Go/Docker`

### Software / Document Management - E-books

*   [Atsumeru](https://atsumeru.xyz) - Manga/comic/light novel media server with clients for Windows, Linux, macOS and Android. ([Source Code (‚≠ê133)](https://github.com/AtsumeruDev/Atsumeru), [Clients](https://atsumeru.xyz/guides/#how-does-it-work)) `MIT` `Java/Docker`
*   [BookLogr (‚≠ê359)](https://github.com/Mozzo1000/booklogr) - Manage your personal book library with ease. ([Demo](https://demo.booklogr.app/)) `Apache-2.0` `Docker`

### Software / E-commerce

*   [Aimeos](https://aimeos.org/) - E-commerce framework for building custom online shops, market places and complex B2B applications scaling to billions of items with Laravel. ([Demo](https://demo.aimeos.org/), [Source Code (‚≠ê4.7k)](https://github.com/aimeos/aimeos)) `LGPL-3.0/MIT` `PHP`

### Software / Feed Readers

*   [Bubo Reader (‚≠ê211)](https://github.com/georgemandis/bubo-rss) - Irrationally minimal RSS feed reader. ([Demo](https://bubo-rss-demo.netlify.app/)) `MIT` `Nodejs`

### Software / File Transfer & Synchronization

*   [bewCloud](https://bewcloud.com) - File sharing + sync, notes, and photos (alternative to Nextcloud and ownCloud's RSS reader). ([Source Code (‚≠ê821)](https://github.com/bewcloud/bewcloud), [Clients](https://github.com/bewcloud)) `AGPL-3.0` `Docker`

### Software / Games

*   [0 A.D.](https://play0ad.com/) - Cross-platform real-time strategy game of ancient warfare. ([Source Code](https://gitea.wildfiregames.com/0ad/0ad)) `MIT/GPL-2.0/Zlib` `C++/C/deb`

### Software / Human Resources Management (HRM)

*   [admidio](https://www.admidio.org/) - User management system for websites of organizations and groups. The system has a flexible role model so that it‚Äôs possible to reflect the structure and permissions of your organization. ([Demo](https://www.admidio.org/demo/), [Source Code (‚≠ê387)](https://github.com/Admidio/admidio)) `GPL-2.0` `PHP/Docker`

### Software / Maps and Global Positioning System (GPS)

*   [AirTrail](https://airtrail.johan.ohly.dk) - Personal flight tracking system. ([Source Code (‚≠ê574)](https://github.com/johanohly/AirTrail)) `GPL-3.0` `Docker/Nodejs`

### Software / Media Management

*   [ChannelTube (‚≠ê218)](https://github.com/TheWicklowWolf/ChannelTube) `‚ö†` - Download video or audio from YouTube channels on a schedule via yt-dlp. `AGPL-3.0` `Docker`
*   [Dagu](https://dagu.readthedocs.io/) - Powerful Cron alternative with a Web UI. It allows you to define dependencies between commands as a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) in a declarative YAML format. ([Source Code (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/dagu-dev/dagu)) `GPL-3.0` `Go/Docker`
*   [Headphones (‚≠ê3.5k)](https://github.com/rembo10/headphones) - Automated music downloader for NZB and Torrent, written in Python. It supports SABnzbd, NZBget, Transmission, ¬µTorrent, Deluge and Blackhole. `GPL-3.0` `Python`
*   [Jellyseerr (‚≠ê5.6k)](https://github.com/Fallenbagel/jellyseerr) - Manage requests for your media library, supports Plex, Jellyfin and Emby media servers (fork of Overseerr). `MIT` `Docker/Nodejs`
*   [LidaTube (‚≠ê260)](https://github.com/TheWicklowWolf/LidaTube) `‚ö†` - Finding and fetch missing Lidarr albums via yt-dlp. `GPL-3.0` `Docker`
*   [Lidify (‚≠ê307)](https://github.com/TheWicklowWolf/Lidify) `‚ö†` - Music discovery tool that provides recommendations based on selected Lidarr artists, using Spotify or LastFM. `MIT` `Docker`
*   [Medusa (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/pymedusa/Medusa) - Automatic Video library manager for TV Shows. It watches for new episodes of your favorite shows, and when they are posted it does its magic. ([Clients (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/medusajs/nextjs-starter-medusa)) `GPL-3.0` `Python`
*   [MetaTube (‚≠ê355)](https://github.com/JVT038/MetaTube) `‚ö†` - Automatically download music from YouTube add metadata from Spotify, Deezer or Musicbrainz. `GPL-3.0` `Python`
*   [MeTube (‚≠ê9.4k)](https://github.com/alexta69/metube) - Web GUI for youtube-dl, with playlist support. Allows downloading videos from dozens of websites. `AGPL-3.0` `Python/Nodejs/Docker`
*   [Pinchflat (‚≠ê3.3k)](https://github.com/kieraneglin/pinchflat) `‚ö†` - Download YouTube content built using yt-dlp. `AGPL-3.0` `Docker`
*   [PlexRipper](https://www.plexripper.rocks/) `‚ö†` - Cross-platform Plex media downloader that seamlessly adds media from other Plex servers to your own. ([Source Code (‚≠ê455)](https://github.com/PlexRipper/PlexRipper)) `GPL-3.0` `Docker`
*   [PodFetch](https://samtv12345.github.io/PodFetch) - Sleek and efficient podcast downloader. ([Source Code (‚≠ê416)](https://github.com/SamTV12345/PodFetch)) `Apache-2.0` `Docker/Rust`
*   [Reiverr (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/aleksilassila/reiverr) `‚ö†` - Clean combined interface for Jellyfin, TMDB, Radarr and Sonarr, as well as a replacement to Overseerr. `AGPL-3.0` `Docker`
*   [SickChill](https://sickchill.github.io/) - Automatic video library manager for TV shows. It watches for new episodes of your favorite shows, and when they are posted it does its magic. ([Source Code (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/SickChill/SickChill)) `GPL-3.0` `Python/Docker`
*   [Sonarr](https://sonarr.tv/) - Automatic TV Shows downloader and manager for Usenet and BitTorrent. It can grab, sort and rename new episodes and automatically upgrade the quality of files already downloaded when a better quality format becomes available. ([Source Code (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/Sonarr/Sonarr)) `GPL-3.0` `C#/Docker`
*   [tubesync (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/meeb/tubesync) `‚ö†` - Syncs YouTube channels and playlists to a locally hosted media server. `AGPL-3.0` `Docker/Python`
*   [Watcharr (‚≠ê922)](https://github.com/sbondCo/Watcharr) - Add and track all the shows and movies you are watching. Comes with user authentication, modern and clean UI and a very simple setup. ([Demo](https://beta.watcharr.app/)) `MIT` `Docker`
*   [ydl\_api\_ng (‚≠ê194)](https://github.com/Totonyus/ydl_api_ng) - Simple youtube-dl REST API to launch downloads on a distant server. `GPL-3.0` `Python`
*   [YoutubeDL-Server (‚≠ê276)](https://github.com/nbr23/youtube-dl-server) - Web and REST interface to Youtube-DL for downloading videos onto a server. `MIT` `Python/Docker`
*   [yt-dlp Web UI (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/marcopeocchi/yt-dlp-web-ui) - Web GUI for yt-dlp. `MPL-2.0` `Docker/Go/Nodejs`

### Software / Media Streaming - Audio Streaming

*   [Audiobookshelf](https://www.audiobookshelf.org/) - Audiobook and podcast server. It streams all audio formats, keeps and syncs progress across devices. Comes with open-source apps for Android and iOS. ([Source Code (‚≠ê9.3k)](https://github.com/advplyr/audiobookshelf), [Clients (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/advplyr/audiobookshelf-app)) `GPL-3.0` `Docker/deb/Nodejs`
*   [AzuraCast](https://www.azuracast.com/) - Modern and accessible web radio management suite. ([Source Code (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/AzuraCast/AzuraCast)) `Apache-2.0` `Docker`
*   [Black Candy (‚≠ê3.6k)](https://github.com/blackcandy-org/black_candy) - Music streaming server. `MIT` `Docker/Ruby`

### Software / Miscellaneous

*   [2FAuth (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/Bubka/2FAuth) - Manage your Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) accounts and generate their security codes. ([Demo](https://demo.2fauth.app/)) `AGPL-3.0` `PHP/Docker`
*   [AlertHub (‚≠ê218)](https://github.com/Ardakilic/alerthub) `‚ö†` - Get alerts from GitHub releases. `MIT` `Nodejs/Docker`
*   [Anchr](https://anchr.io) - Toolbox for tiny tasks on the internet, including bookmark collections, URL shortening and (encrypted) image uploads. ([Source Code (‚≠ê337)](https://github.com/muety/anchr)) `GPL-3.0` `Nodejs`
*   [Baby Buddy (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/babybuddy/babybuddy) - Helps caregivers track baby sleep, feedings, diaper changes, and tummy time. ([Demo (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/babybuddy/babybuddy#-demo)) `BSD-2-Clause` `Python`
*   [beelzebub](https://beelzebub-honeypot.com/) `‚ö†` - Honeypot framework designed to provide a highly secure environment for detecting and analyzing cyber attacks. ([Source Code (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/mariocandela/beelzebub)) `MIT` `Docker/K8S/Go`

### Software / Money, Budgeting & Management

*   [Bigcapital](https://bigcapital.app/) - Financial accounting and inventory management software for small to medium businesses. ([Source Code (‚≠ê2.9k)](https://github.com/bigcapitalhq/bigcapital)) `AGPL-3.0` `Docker`
*   [Bitcart](https://bitcart.ai) - Cryptocurrencies payment processor and development platform. ([Demo](https://admin.bitcart.ai), [Source Code (‚≠ê676)](https://github.com/bitcart/bitcart)) `MIT` `Docker/Python/Nodejs`
*   [BTCPay Server](https://btcpayserver.org/) - Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies payment processor. ([Demo](https://mainnet.demo.btcpayserver.org/), [Source Code (‚≠ê6.9k)](https://github.com/btcpayserver/btcpayserver)) `MIT` `C#`

### Software / Password Managers

*   [Bitwarden](https://bitwarden.com/) `‚ö†` - Password manager with a webapp, browser extension, and mobile app. ([Source Code (‚≠ê17k)](https://github.com/bitwarden/server)) `AGPL-3.0` `Docker/C#`

### Software / Polls and Events

*   [Bitpoll (‚≠ê272)](https://github.com/fsinfuhh/Bitpoll) - Conduct polls about dates, times or general questions. ([Demo](https://bitpoll.de/)) `GPL-3.0` `Docker/Python`
*   [Bracket](https://docs.bracketapp.nl/) - Flexible tournament system to build a tournament setup, add teams, schedule matches, keep track of scores and present ranking live to the public. ([Demo](https://www.bracketapp.nl/demo), [Source Code (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/evroon/bracket)) `AGPL-3.0` `Docker/Nodejs`

### Software / Recipe Management

*   [Bar Assistant](https://barassistant.app/) - Manage your home bar while adding your ingredients, searching for cocktails and creating custom cocktail recipes. ([Demo](https://demo.barassistant.app/), [Source Code (‚≠ê815)](https://github.com/karlomikus/bar-assistant)) `MIT` `PHP/Docker`

### Software / Software Development - Localization

*   [Accent](https://www.accent.reviews/) - Developer-oriented translation tool. ([Source Code (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/mirego/accent)) `BSD-3-Clause` `Elixir/Docker`

### Software / Software Development - Low Code

*   [Appsmith](https://www.appsmith.com/) - Build admin panels, CRUD apps and workflows. Build everything you need, 10x faster. ([Source Code (‚≠ê37k)](https://github.com/appsmithorg/appsmith)) `Apache-2.0` `Java/Docker/K8S`

### Software / Software Development - Testing

*   [Bencher](https://bencher.dev/) - Suite of continuous benchmarking tools designed to catch performance regressions in CI. ([Source Code (‚≠ê716)](https://github.com/bencherdev/bencher)) `MIT/Apache-2.0` `Rust`

### Software / Task Management & To-do Lists

*   [AppFlowy](https://appflowy.io/) - Build detailed lists of to-do‚Äôs for different projects while tracking the status of each one. Open Source Notion Alternative. ([Source Code (‚≠ê64k)](https://github.com/AppFlowy-IO/appflowy)) `AGPL-3.0` `Rust/Dart/Docker`

### Software / Time Tracking

*   [ActivityWatch](https://activitywatch.net) - Automatically track how you spend time on your devices. ([Source Code (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/ActivityWatch/activitywatch)) `MPL-2.0` `Python`

### Software / URL Shorteners

*   [bit (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/sjdonado/bit) - Fast, lightweight, resource-efficient, compiled URL shortener. `MIT` `Docker/Crystal`

### Software / Wikis

*   [BookStack](https://www.bookstackapp.com/) - Organize and store information. Stores documentation in a book like fashion. ([Demo](https://www.bookstackapp.com/#demo), [Source Code (‚≠ê17k)](https://github.com/BookStackApp/BookStack)) `MIT` `PHP/Docker`
items.content_html:
Software / Analytics

  • Aptabase - Privacy first and simple analytics for mobile and desktop apps. (Source Code (‚≠ê1.4k)) AGPL-3.0 Docker

Software / Archiving and Digital Preservation (DP)

  • bitmagnet - BitTorrent indexer, DHT crawler, content classifier and torrent search engine with web UI, GraphQL API and Servarr stack integration. (Source Code (‚≠ê3.2k)) MIT Go/Docker

Software / Automation

  • Apache Airflow - Platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows. (Source Code (‚≠ê41k)) Apache-2.0 Python/Docker

Software / Booking and Scheduling

  • Alf.io - Ticket reservation system. (Demo, Source Code (‚≠ê1.5k)) GPL-3.0 Java

Software / Bookmarks and Link Sharing

  • Buku (‚≠ê6.8k) - Powerful bookmark manager and a personal textual mini-web. GPL-3.0 Python/deb

Software / Communication - Email - Complete Solutions

  • AnonAddy - Email forwarding service for creating aliases. (Source Code (‚≠ê3.9k)) MIT PHP/Docker

Software / Communication - Social Networks and Forums

  • Answer - Knowledge-based community software. You can use it to quickly build your Q&A community for product technical support, customer support, user communication, and more. (Source Code (‚≠ê15k)) Apache-2.0 Docker/Go
  • Artalk - Comment system built in Golang, providing a lightweight and highly customizable solution for adding comments to your website. (Source Code (‚≠ê2k)) MIT Go/Docker
  • AsmBB - Fast, SQLite-powered forum engine written in ASM. (Source Code) EUPL-1.2 Assembly

Software / Content Management Systems (CMS)

  • BigTree CMS - Straightforward, well documented, and capable CMS. (Source Code (‚≠ê220)) LGPL-2.1 PHP
  • Bludit ‚ö† - Build a site or blog in seconds. Bludit uses flat-files (text files in JSON format) to store posts and pages. (Source Code (‚≠ê1.3k)) MIT PHP

Software / DNS

  • AdGuard Home - User-friendly ads & trackers blocking DNS server. (Source Code (‚≠ê29k)) GPL-3.0 Docker
  • blocky - Fast and lightweight DNS proxy as ad-blocker for local network with many features (alternative to Pi-hole). (Source Code (‚≠ê5.4k)) Apache-2.0 Go/Docker

Software / Document Management - E-books

  • Atsumeru - Manga/comic/light novel media server with clients for Windows, Linux, macOS and Android. (Source Code (‚≠ê133), Clients) MIT Java/Docker
  • BookLogr (‚≠ê359) - Manage your personal book library with ease. (Demo) Apache-2.0 Docker

Software / E-commerce

  • Aimeos - E-commerce framework for building custom online shops, market places and complex B2B applications scaling to billions of items with Laravel. (Demo, Source Code (‚≠ê4.7k)) LGPL-3.0/MIT PHP

Software / Feed Readers

  • Bubo Reader (‚≠ê211) - Irrationally minimal RSS feed reader. (Demo) MIT Nodejs

Software / File Transfer & Synchronization

  • bewCloud - File sharing + sync, notes, and photos (alternative to Nextcloud and ownCloud's RSS reader). (Source Code (‚≠ê821), Clients) AGPL-3.0 Docker

Software / Games

  • 0 A.D. - Cross-platform real-time strategy game of ancient warfare. (Source Code) MIT/GPL-2.0/Zlib C++/C/deb

Software / Human Resources Management (HRM)

  • admidio - User management system for websites of organizations and groups. The system has a flexible role model so that it‚Äôs possible to reflect the structure and permissions of your organization. (Demo, Source Code (‚≠ê387)) GPL-2.0 PHP/Docker

Software / Maps and Global Positioning System (GPS)

  • AirTrail - Personal flight tracking system. (Source Code (‚≠ê574)) GPL-3.0 Docker/Nodejs

Software / Media Management

  • ChannelTube (‚≠ê218) ‚ö† - Download video or audio from YouTube channels on a schedule via yt-dlp. AGPL-3.0 Docker
  • Dagu - Powerful Cron alternative with a Web UI. It allows you to define dependencies between commands as a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) in a declarative YAML format. (Source Code (‚≠ê2.4k)) GPL-3.0 Go/Docker
  • Headphones (‚≠ê3.5k) - Automated music downloader for NZB and Torrent, written in Python. It supports SABnzbd, NZBget, Transmission, ¬µTorrent, Deluge and Blackhole. GPL-3.0 Python
  • Jellyseerr (‚≠ê5.6k) - Manage requests for your media library, supports Plex, Jellyfin and Emby media servers (fork of Overseerr). MIT Docker/Nodejs
  • LidaTube (‚≠ê260) ‚ö† - Finding and fetch missing Lidarr albums via yt-dlp. GPL-3.0 Docker
  • Lidify (‚≠ê307) ‚ö† - Music discovery tool that provides recommendations based on selected Lidarr artists, using Spotify or LastFM. MIT Docker
  • Medusa (‚≠ê1.9k) - Automatic Video library manager for TV Shows. It watches for new episodes of your favorite shows, and when they are posted it does its magic. (Clients (‚≠ê2.3k)) GPL-3.0 Python
  • MetaTube (‚≠ê355) ‚ö† - Automatically download music from YouTube add metadata from Spotify, Deezer or Musicbrainz. GPL-3.0 Python
  • MeTube (‚≠ê9.4k) - Web GUI for youtube-dl, with playlist support. Allows downloading videos from dozens of websites. AGPL-3.0 Python/Nodejs/Docker
  • Pinchflat (‚≠ê3.3k) ‚ö† - Download YouTube content built using yt-dlp. AGPL-3.0 Docker
  • PlexRipper ‚ö† - Cross-platform Plex media downloader that seamlessly adds media from other Plex servers to your own. (Source Code (‚≠ê455)) GPL-3.0 Docker
  • PodFetch - Sleek and efficient podcast downloader. (Source Code (‚≠ê416)) Apache-2.0 Docker/Rust
  • Reiverr (‚≠ê1.8k) ‚ö† - Clean combined interface for Jellyfin, TMDB, Radarr and Sonarr, as well as a replacement to Overseerr. AGPL-3.0 Docker
  • SickChill - Automatic video library manager for TV shows. It watches for new episodes of your favorite shows, and when they are posted it does its magic. (Source Code (‚≠ê2.4k)) GPL-3.0 Python/Docker
  • Sonarr - Automatic TV Shows downloader and manager for Usenet and BitTorrent. It can grab, sort and rename new episodes and automatically upgrade the quality of files already downloaded when a better quality format becomes available. (Source Code (‚≠ê12k)) GPL-3.0 C#/Docker
  • tubesync (‚≠ê2.3k) ‚ö† - Syncs YouTube channels and playlists to a locally hosted media server. AGPL-3.0 Docker/Python
  • Watcharr (‚≠ê922) - Add and track all the shows and movies you are watching. Comes with user authentication, modern and clean UI and a very simple setup. (Demo) MIT Docker
  • ydl_api_ng (‚≠ê194) - Simple youtube-dl REST API to launch downloads on a distant server. GPL-3.0 Python
  • YoutubeDL-Server (‚≠ê276) - Web and REST interface to Youtube-DL for downloading videos onto a server. MIT Python/Docker
  • yt-dlp Web UI (‚≠ê1.7k) - Web GUI for yt-dlp. MPL-2.0 Docker/Go/Nodejs

Software / Media Streaming - Audio Streaming

  • Audiobookshelf - Audiobook and podcast server. It streams all audio formats, keeps and syncs progress across devices. Comes with open-source apps for Android and iOS. (Source Code (‚≠ê9.3k), Clients (‚≠ê1.8k)) GPL-3.0 Docker/deb/Nodejs
  • AzuraCast - Modern and accessible web radio management suite. (Source Code (‚≠ê3.4k)) Apache-2.0 Docker
  • Black Candy (‚≠ê3.6k) - Music streaming server. MIT Docker/Ruby

Software / Miscellaneous

  • 2FAuth (‚≠ê2.9k) - Manage your Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) accounts and generate their security codes. (Demo) AGPL-3.0 PHP/Docker
  • AlertHub (‚≠ê218) ‚ö† - Get alerts from GitHub releases. MIT Nodejs/Docker
  • Anchr - Toolbox for tiny tasks on the internet, including bookmark collections, URL shortening and (encrypted) image uploads. (Source Code (‚≠ê337)) GPL-3.0 Nodejs
  • Baby Buddy (‚≠ê2.4k) - Helps caregivers track baby sleep, feedings, diaper changes, and tummy time. (Demo (‚≠ê2.4k)) BSD-2-Clause Python
  • beelzebub ‚ö† - Honeypot framework designed to provide a highly secure environment for detecting and analyzing cyber attacks. (Source Code (‚≠ê1.3k)) MIT Docker/K8S/Go

Software / Money, Budgeting & Management

  • Bigcapital - Financial accounting and inventory management software for small to medium businesses. (Source Code (‚≠ê2.9k)) AGPL-3.0 Docker
  • Bitcart - Cryptocurrencies payment processor and development platform. (Demo, Source Code (‚≠ê676)) MIT Docker/Python/Nodejs
  • BTCPay Server - Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies payment processor. (Demo, Source Code (‚≠ê6.9k)) MIT C#

Software / Password Managers

  • Bitwarden ‚ö† - Password manager with a webapp, browser extension, and mobile app. (Source Code (‚≠ê17k)) AGPL-3.0 Docker/C#

Software / Polls and Events

  • Bitpoll (‚≠ê272) - Conduct polls about dates, times or general questions. (Demo) GPL-3.0 Docker/Python
  • Bracket - Flexible tournament system to build a tournament setup, add teams, schedule matches, keep track of scores and present ranking live to the public. (Demo, Source Code (‚≠ê1.3k)) AGPL-3.0 Docker/Nodejs

Software / Recipe Management

  • Bar Assistant - Manage your home bar while adding your ingredients, searching for cocktails and creating custom cocktail recipes. (Demo, Source Code (‚≠ê815)) MIT PHP/Docker

Software / Software Development - Localization

  • Accent - Developer-oriented translation tool. (Source Code (‚≠ê1.4k)) BSD-3-Clause Elixir/Docker

Software / Software Development - Low Code

  • Appsmith - Build admin panels, CRUD apps and workflows. Build everything you need, 10x faster. (Source Code (‚≠ê37k)) Apache-2.0 Java/Docker/K8S

Software / Software Development - Testing

  • Bencher - Suite of continuous benchmarking tools designed to catch performance regressions in CI. (Source Code (‚≠ê716)) MIT/Apache-2.0 Rust

Software / Task Management & To-do Lists

  • AppFlowy - Build detailed lists of to-do‚Äôs for different projects while tracking the status of each one. Open Source Notion Alternative. (Source Code (‚≠ê64k)) AGPL-3.0 Rust/Dart/Docker

Software / Time Tracking

  • ActivityWatch - Automatically track how you spend time on your devices. (Source Code (‚≠ê15k)) MPL-2.0 Python

Software / URL Shorteners

  • bit (‚≠ê38) - Fast, lightweight, resource-efficient, compiled URL shortener. MIT Docker/Crystal

Software / Wikis

  • BookStack - Organize and store information. Stores documentation in a book like fashion. (Demo, Source Code (‚≠ê17k)) MIT PHP/Docker

items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### Abduction / Applications in AI

*   [Machine Translation Using Abductive Inference](https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/H91-1024.pdf) - ***COLING***, 1990. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=15275163177548183539)]. Many existing approaches to machine translation take for granted that the information presented in the output is found somewhere in the input, and, moreover, that such information should be expressed at a single representational level, say, in terms of the parse trees or of "semantic" assertions. Languages, however, not only express the equivalent information by drastically different linguistic means, but also often disagree in what distinctions should be expressed linguistically at all. For example, in translating from Japanese to English, it is often necessary to supply determiners for noun phrases, and this in general cannot be done without deep understanding of the source text. Similarly, in translating from English to Japanese, politeness considerations, which in English are implicit in the social situation and explicit in very diffuse ways in, for example, the heavy use of hypotheticals, must be realized grammatically in Japanese. Machine translation therefore requires that the appropriate inferences be drawn and that the text be interpreted to some depth. Recently, an elegant approach to inference in discourse interpretation has been developed at a number of sites, all based on the notion of abduction, and the authors have begun to explore its potential application to machine translation. The authors argue that this approach provides the possibility of deep reasoning and of mapping between the languages at a variety of levels.
items.content_html:
Abduction / Applications in AI

  • Machine Translation Using Abductive Inference - COLING, 1990. [All Versions]. Many existing approaches to machine translation take for granted that the information presented in the output is found somewhere in the input, and, moreover, that such information should be expressed at a single representational level, say, in terms of the parse trees or of "semantic" assertions. Languages, however, not only express the equivalent information by drastically different linguistic means, but also often disagree in what distinctions should be expressed linguistically at all. For example, in translating from Japanese to English, it is often necessary to supply determiners for noun phrases, and this in general cannot be done without deep understanding of the source text. Similarly, in translating from English to Japanese, politeness considerations, which in English are implicit in the social situation and explicit in very diffuse ways in, for example, the heavy use of hypotheticals, must be realized grammatically in Japanese. Machine translation therefore requires that the appropriate inferences be drawn and that the text be interpreted to some depth. Recently, an elegant approach to inference in discourse interpretation has been developed at a number of sites, all based on the notion of abduction, and the authors have begun to explore its potential application to machine translation. The authors argue that this approach provides the possibility of deep reasoning and of mapping between the languages at a variety of levels.
